name:G‚Äçu‚Äçe‚Äçs‚Äçt‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr
info:Standard Room
info:Stayed in April 2024
info:Business travelers
info:35 Reviews
rating:4.7
posted:Posted April 21, 2024
msg:This is the second time I stayed at Beijing Hotel. Every time I stayed, I fell asleep surprisingly quickly. I could fall asleep as soon as I put on the pillow. One of the two pillows had some beans, which was just right. It was very comfortable to sleep. The shower in the bathroom is in the bathtub. The curtain was drawn, but the non-slip mat was very comfortable to step on. I don't know if it's because they receive many foreign guests, but the comfort of the room is always good, although the decoration is simple and plain. I will stay here again.
If you have heavy luggage, it is recommended to take a taxi. If you take the subway, there is no elevator at the subway station at the door.
----------------------------------------
name:A‚Äçn‚Äço‚Äçn‚Äçy‚Äçm‚Äço‚Äçu‚Äçs‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr
info:Standard Room
info:Stayed in April 2024
info:Other
info:50 Reviews
rating:4
posted:Posted April 21, 2024
msg:We stayed at the Beijing Hotel, which is full of history. The location of the hotel is very advantageous. It is not an exaggeration to say that it is in the heart of the capital. It is opposite the Chang'an Club. Not far away on both sides are Tiananmen Square, the Great Hall of the People, the National Museum, and Chairman Mao Memorial Hall. Behind it is Wangfujing Street, the first street in China. The subway entrance is very close. It takes only ten steps to get there after leaving the hotel. It is very convenient to travel. However, the interior decoration of the hotel does not seem to match its reputation. Except for the old photos in the historical exhibition gallery, the heavy and glorious historical relics are almost invisible. What we saw is an ordinary old hotel with ordinary decoration and ordinary service. The hotel rooms do not provide air conditioning in April, which is incredible for us southerners. The beds and cabinets are like the styles of 20 years ago. The mattresses are hard and inelastic. Of course, the sheets and quilts are very clean and fresh, and the carpets are also clean. The swimming pool is hard to describe. The water is a bit turbid, the locker room is simply furnished, and the shower room uses cheap plastic curtains, which are half rolled up due to aging and can hardly cover the guests who are taking a shower. There were no bath towels, so we asked the waiter for some, and the reply was that we had to bring our own bath towels to the room, which surprised us again... Of course, staying in the hotel for five nights also brought us unexpected gains. We were deeply moved and admired by the professionalism of Mr. He Qiujing. During the history of Beijing Hotel arranged by the hotel, he told us in detail and seriously about the past and present of Beijing Hotel and its glorious history, which made me listen with great interest and also gave birth to endless emotion. Beijing Hotel was born in old China, but it witnessed the process of the People's Republic of China from poverty and backwardness to prosperity. This is also a vivid patriotism education. We are very grateful to Mr. He for his professional explanation. At the same time, my husband and I sincerely hope that Beijing Hotel will live up to expectations and work hard to polish the golden signboard of Beijing Hotel. Unfortunately, we failed to live up to the high expectations of our guests.
----------------------------------------

The rooms are spacious and have high ceilings.
The hotel is old so the water pressure is low. There is some black mold here and there.
There is no room service menu in the room. You can order by taking a photo of the restaurant menu. You can only pay by cash or WeChat.
You can't charge bills to your room.
The hotel's Wi-Fi is Google. You can't use Yahoo search, but you can access Yahoo mail.

name:C‚Äçh‚Äçe‚Äçn‚ÄçL‚Äço‚Äçu‚Äçr‚Äçs‚Äço‚Äçn
info:Superior Standard Room
info:Stayed in February 2024
info:Family
info:11 Reviews
rating:5
posted:Posted February 26, 2024
msg:Booking a stay in advance for New Year's Eve, the price is not bad for Beijing. After all, it is an old five-star hotel. Overall, the price/performance ratio is very high.
        The location is very good. It is on the north side of Chang'an Street, with Wangfujing Metro Station downstairs. It is within walking distance to Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. It is very close to the core area and can be said to be the first choice for traveling around Tiananmen Square. It is also very convenient to go for a walk at night. After all, it is right at the entrance of Wangfujing, and the transportation to Nanluoguxiang and other places is very convenient.
        The room layout is okay. I chose a south-facing room with a large balcony (although entry is not allowed). There is plenty of sunlight, the heating temperature is turned up high, and the sound insulation is quite good. The only drawback is that the facilities and equipment are a bit old. The TV, tables and chairs are a bit old, and the wallpaper is a bit peeling. There is only a bathtub for bathing. Fortunately, the water temperature is OK and it is durable enough.
        I am very satisfied with the service. The front desk is very efficient. Check-in, check-out and deposit refund are very fast. I am also very patient in answering questions. The luggage storage is always guarded by someone, which makes you feel at ease.
        Overall, I am very satisfied. I will give priority to Beijing Hotel when I come to Beijing in the future.

name:A‚Äçn‚Äço‚Äçn‚Äçy‚Äçm‚Äço‚Äçu‚Äçs‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr
info:Superior Standard Room
info:Stayed in January 2024
info:Couples
info:42 Reviews
rating:5
posted:Posted January 22, 2024
msg:Beijing Hotel, this is Beijing Hotel! How many great people have lived here; before the founding ceremony, the national flag, national emblem and national anthem were selected here; the first banquet of the founding of the country on the day of the founding ceremony was held here.

Needless to say, the location is just perfect, with Wangfujing to the east, Nanheyan Street to the west, Chang'an Street in front of the door, and Exit C of Wangfujing Station of Metro Line 1 at the door. It actually takes 15 minutes to walk to Tiananmen Square normally.

This place can be visited as a museum. When you enter the lobby of Building A, there is a dedicated corridor with a complete history introduction of the hotel. Walk through the historical corridor to the banquet hall. There are many exquisite handicrafts placed along the way, including the Eight Wonders of Yanjing. It is very worth it. visit.

The breakfast is very rich, the buffet combines Chinese and Western styles, and has many varieties. Recommend the noodles and tea soup made on site.

The room is indeed rather retro, but I think that's what it should be. The room facing Chang'an Street has a balcony, but unfortunately it is locked and cannot be opened. There is a slight lack of sound insulation, but this is a common problem in all hotels.

The accommodation price is really reasonable and the staff are very polite. Thank you Xiao Zhai team. The handsome guy selling tea soup at breakfast deserves praise. The parking lot is on the ground in front of the hotel when you turn into Chang'an Street. The parking fee for hotel guests is 60 for a whole day. You can just ask the front desk staff to operate it when you leave the hotel.

Service: The front desk and housekeeping depar**ent responded very quickly and were very nice. Thumbs up. The greeter at the door only looked at the luggage, and the guests did not help with their luggage when they got off the bus. It was not a good experience.
Catering: I only experienced breakfast. There are many types of food, but the taste is really not good. The wonton wrappers were all rotten, and I was really shocked when I saw the omelette chef pick up an omelette, tear off the burnt corner with his hands, and then put it back!
Facilities: It is really an old hotel. The front and lobby are ok, but the room is really unsatisfactory. There are few sockets and no USB plugs. The TV signal is very poor and it will freeze suddenly. Needless to say, the wifi signal is even worse. The shower in the bathroom cannot be taken off for flushing, and there is not even a makeup mirror. There is no carpet. There are old stains on the walls, and the sound insulation is so poor that you can clearly hear the movement in the corridor next door upstairs. The most annoying thing is that the connecting room is right next to the safety exit. Someone was smoking behind the safety door in the morning. The smell of smoke in our room was annoying!
In addition, the decorative tree in the Sunshine Restaurant has several light wires that are dragged directly to the ground, which can easily trip children and the elderly, posing a serious safety hazard.
A five-star hotel with a history should not be so disappointing. I hope the management pays attention to guest experience and improves the problems. I sincerely hope that Beijing Hotel will get better and better in the future.
----------------------------------------

name:G‚Äçu‚Äçe‚Äçs‚Äçt‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr

posted:Posted November 11, 2023
msg:For this trip to Beijing, I did my homework on Ctrip in advance and chose to stay at the Beijing Hotel, which is very cost-effective. As an old five-star hotel, the location is quite advantageous. Metro Wangfujing Station Line 1 and Line 8 are right in front of the hotel. Wangfujing Station The pedestrian street is next to the hotel, so traveling is very convenient. Quanjude and Donglaishun are on Wangfujing Street, very close to Beijing Hotel. The Beijing Hotel has a grand appearance and a solemn and luxurious lobby. The front desk staff is warm and thoughtful, and the check-in procedure is completed quickly. The elevator is an old Mitsubishi elevator, but it is well maintained and the elevator runs smoothly. The room is spacious and bright, with a complete range of bathroom toiletries and 6 bottles of drinking water every day, which is enough to cope with Beijing's dry weather. From the window on the 17th floor where we stayed, we could see the Palace Museum and the White Tower of Beihai Park. Tiananmen Square and the Palace Museum are right next to it, a 5-minute walk away. To enter Tiananmen Square and the Palace Museum, you need to make a reservation in advance. You need to go through two security checks, and your ID card must be checked. When visiting the Badaling Great Wall, it is recommended to take a one-day tour with Ctrip, 99 yuan/person. It is best to bring your own dry food and drinking water. If you have a tight meal time in Badaling. When coming back from Badaling, we will stop at the Bird's Nest and Water Cube, and check in and take photos. You can basically reach other places by taking the subway. Taxis or Didi rides are not expensive, and you can take a look at the cityscape of Beijing.

name:G‚Äçu‚Äça‚Äçn‚Äçg‚Äçz‚Äçh‚Äço‚Äçu‚Äçl‚Äça‚Äço‚Äçj‚Äçi‚Äça‚Äçn‚Äçg
info:Superior Standard Room
info:Stayed in July 2023
info:Family
info:53 Reviews
rating:1
posted:Posted July 30, 2023
msg:On the Importance of Labels and Outer Packaging
Story version 1: A century-old store with a five-star benchmark. Located at the entrance of Wangfujing Pedestrian Street, overlooking the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and the Great Hall of the People, it is only 1 kilometer walk to Tiananmen Square. The founding leaders of the country once received foreign guests from various countries here. (See Group Figure 1 for details).
Story version 2: The Genxia Town Guest House in the Imperial City. First, hardware facilities. There was a musty smell upon entering. The room I live in: the air conditioner can‚Äôt adjust the temperature, only the wind speed, and it‚Äôs buzzing all night; the bedside lamp is off, and it‚Äôs still blinking, so I take it off directly; the bedside phone is up and down, contact customer service The center has to call the front desk through mobile phones; the beds, TVs, and furniture in the rooms are equipped with small town guest houses in the 1990s (see photo 2 for details). Second, service awareness. In the case of the hardware configuration of the small town guest house, the service can be regarded as the service level of the village. Maybe these waiters receive state officials all day long, subconsciously feel that they are leaders above the bureau level, and when they see us from other places, they all have a superior look and attitude. There were no toiletries in the room, so I asked the customer service center to get them, but the waiter dropped two of them for me with a look of giving. The security guards in the lobby can be compared to the bullishness of Zhongnanhai's bodyguards. They think we are all grandma Liu who came to the Beijing Hotel to enjoy the glory, with a proud expression. Third, service level. The TV University bullies customers and ignores them. Complain, no one cares. You can't live with your love, anyway, there are a lot of "leeks" in the country.
As an old "leek" who has lived in a hotel for 20 years, this is the first time that he has been cut too hard, and he feels that his IQ has been insulted.
If you come here because of the reputation and need to check in, this is still a good choice. If you have certain requirements for the environment and services, it is recommended to choose carefully to avoid getting into the pit. This pit may forever be loaded into your memory as a "choice error".
Based on my experience of staying in the hotel for many years, plus my own personal verification, many of the good reviews of this hotel are just brushed out, so read more about the pertinent reviews in the negative reviews.

It is quite convenient to go to the train station and airport, and it is also very convenient to go shopping in other places. It's also very close to Tiananmen Square, but unfortunately I don't have time
Service: The service of Beijing Hotel is very good. I booked a double bed room. The front desk arranged for me to be on the 16th floor. The floor is quite high and very quiet. It is quite convenient to go to Peking Union Medical College Hospital for medical trea**ent.
Environment: The environment of Beijing Hotel is good, the scenery is good, looking out from the window of the room, the night view is quite beautiful
Room facilities: Beijing Hotel rooms do not provide disposable toiletries. You can bring them yourself or ask the hotel for them. I asked the hotel for a comb, but I got 2 combs. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because Beijing time is relatively old. There is no socket, so it is very inconvenient to charge the phone at night, but there are devices at the bedside to control the lights and air conditioners in the room, which is quite convenient
    Overall, the Beijing Hotel is pretty good. The price is actually pretty good. It‚Äôs very convenient. When you get up in the morning, go to the hospital for a blood test. You just have breakfast when you come back. If you have the opportunity to come to Beijing in the future, you will still consider staying at the Beijing Hotel

posted:Posted May 30, 2023
msg:Beijing Hotel is located on the east side of the majestic Tiananmen Square, next to Wangfujing Commercial Street. As a high-end hotel with a century-old history, its location is excellent.
On the night of the founding ceremony on October 1, 1949, Beijing Hotel hosted the "first banquet of the founding of the country". Since then, it has become an important place for new China's state affairs activities and foreign affairs reception, and has received heads of state and government from many countries and regions.
In the early years, Beijing could only take a picture in front of the Beijing Hotel. Now ordinary people can stay in this old five-star hotel full of stories. Although the hotel facilities are a bit old, they are well maintained and comfortable to live in. The price/performance ratio of the hotel is also very good.
The only downside is that the service needs to be improved. Especially for the check-in at the front desk, the check-in peak is at 3 and 4 o'clock in the afternoon, and only two counters are open. It takes at least half an hour to wait in a long line to check in, which does not match the five-star standard.

posted:Posted May 2, 2023
msg:The Beijing Hotel really surprised me this time! I didn't have good expectations. After all, the hotel is relatively old. I chose this place purely for the location. I thought that although it is old, it is an old five-star hotel after all, and the service should be good in all aspects! When I opened the door, I could smell a bad smell. It took a long time to adjust the air conditioner to the lowest temperature to get any effect. Because we had children with us, we called the room service and said that we hoped to give an extra quilt. I didn't expect the attitude of the room service to be a bit annoying, saying that there may not be any, so we can only ask! Then there will be no further text! In the end, no quilt was delivered! After resting for an hour, we went out to Tiananmen Square. We returned to the hotel at night and found that the socket at the head of the bed had been disconnected from charging. We tried to find another charging socket, only to find that the back of the TV cabinet was rubbish! There are empty mineral water bottles and cash receipts and the like! But because I was really tired, thinking about the attitude of the room service in the afternoon, I didn't want to argue with the hotel anymore, so I took a photo! I checked out the next morning and showed the photos to the front desk to remind them of hygiene problems! Afterwards, a hotel staff member called me, probably meaning that they would upgrade my room type next time and treat me to dinner so that I would not give bad reviews, saying that online reviews are very important to them, but I refused! Because I think that only an objective and true evaluation can really urge the hotel to face up to its own problems! As a tourist, I really don't want to affect my mood because of these reasons, so I haven't found a hotel theory. As a hotel, don't use the above problems as a reason to receive a lot of guests on May Day. The hotel's reception capacity and service level are indeed not five-star hotels. standard!

msg:Known as the 120-year-old hotel, this time I stayed in Area A and felt that the room facilities were aging, especially the bathtub in the bathroom was still using plastic shower curtains. There is also the room price, standard room is 889 yuan, including breakfast is 1201 yuan, and the buffet breakfast is only 120 yuan per person, how to explain? Except for the very enthusiastic service staff, breakfast is nothing remarkable. Of course, we did our homework in advance and visited the lobby of Tower B. We especially recommend the golden lobby of Tower C, which is magnificent.

name:G‚Äçu‚Äçe‚Äçs‚Äçt‚Äç ‚ÄçU‚Äçs‚Äçe‚Äçr
info:Standard Room
info:Stayed in August 2021
info:Family
info:2 Reviews
rating:5
posted:Posted August 15, 2021
msg:When I arrived in Beijing on 8.1, I happened to encounter a new wave of epidemics. The Beijing Hotel is located on Chang'an Avenue. Every day there are staff checking health treasures and temperature measurements. At night there is a little brother on duty at the elevator on the first floor. There are not many people staying because of the epidemic, but it is a veteran five-star on Chang'an Avenue. The safety of the first-class hotel is guaranteed. Armed police patrol the door 24 hours a day, allowing me to stay in Beijing for 6 days with peace of mind. The neighborhood is very close to Wangfujing Pedestrian Street, and Wangfujing C1 subway station is just outside the gate. It is really convenient for eating, drinking, and traveling. Although the bathroom is very large, the bathtub is really unnecessary. I have to step into the bathtub every day when I take a shower. There is also a hotel hanger. When I used it on the first day, I found a strange hair-like thing stuck on it. I hope the hotel can seriously disinfect the hanger after each guest leaves, so that the next guest can stay at ease.

posted:Posted July 28, 2021
msg:Originally the service could be given 5 stars. At 12 o‚Äôclock noon on the 25th, I took two 75-year-olds and a child to the hotel and checked in. A male waiter at the front desk looked at our documents and said that we would not be able to check in until 2 o‚Äôclock. , We just waited in the lobby. The lobby was very large and there were few seats. It took a long time for the elderly to stand before anyone left and they could take their seats. About half past one, I went to the front desk again to ask if I could check in. The waiter said that the time was not up, so I walked to the side. At this time, a guest came to the front desk to open a room. The waiter immediately checked in for him. Then a guest wanted to check in just like me. He also answered that he can check in at two o'clock, and said, "You can check in online. Didn‚Äôt I check the time for the booking?‚Äù Later, I checked in at the waitress next to me. The waitress also checked in for me without saying anything. It was also a waiter. Why was it totally different.
        The hotel is very large, although the facilities are a bit old, but very clean. Except for the male waiter at the front desk, the other waiters are very good, the service is in place and responsive. The room was large, clean, and had a big balcony, but the door was locked and could not be opened, and the view was superb. The hotel is on Chang'an Avenue, 10 minutes walk west is the Tiananmen Gate Tower and square, and a little bit north is the Meridian Gate of the Forbidden City. Go out the gate and turn left to Wangfujing Street. It is very convenient for shopping and eating. The subway station is right at the door, so it's convenient to go anywhere.

There is no history of the hotel, and I can't find it better in Beijing. But the room is relatively old, compared with other five-star hotels, which is a three-star standard. The height of the room is good, it can be seen that it was built according to the highest specifications at the time, and the overall equipment and facilities are too general.
